Generation V.Black: When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave their own belts.
Generation V.White: When they encounter foes bigger than themselves, they try to throw them. They always travel in packs of five.
Generation V.Black 2: When it encounters a foe bigger than itself, it wants to throw it. It changes belts as it gets stronger.
Generation V.White 2: When it encounters a foe bigger than itself, it wants to throw it. It changes belts as it gets stronger.

Generation VI.X: When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave their own belts.
Generation VI.Y: When it encounters a foe bigger than itself, it wants to throw it. It changes belts as it gets stronger.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave their own belts.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: When it encounters a foe bigger than itself, it wants to throw it. It changes belts as it gets stronger.

Generation VIII.Sword: It performs throwing moves with first-rate skill. Over the course of many battles, Throh's belt grows darker as it absorbs its wearer's sweat.
Generation VIII.Shield: They train in groups of five. Any member that can't keep up will discard its belt and leave the group.

Generation V.Black: Routes 10 , 15 , and 18 , Pinwheel Forest (outside) ( rustling grass )
Generation V.White: Routes 10 , 15 , and 18 , Pinwheel Forest (outside) ( tall grass )
Generation V.Black 2: Routes 15 , 18 , and 23 , Pinwheel Forest (outside) ( rustling grass ) Victory Road ( tall grass )
Generation V.White 2: Routes 15 , 18 , and 23 , Pinwheel Forest (outside), Victory Road ( tall grass )

Generation VIII.Shield: Route 8 , Bridge Field , Giant's Mirror , Motostoke Outskirts , Motostoke Riverbank North Lake Miloch , Dusty Bowl ( Max Raid Battle )
